org.drooms.api

Interface Game


  • public interface Game
    Represents a certain type of game, with its own rules and constraints.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GameProgressListener getReport()
      Retrieve the main report of this game, detailing the progress of the game.
      Map<Player,Integer> play(Playground playground, Collection<Player> players, File reportFolder)
      Initialize the game and play it through.
      void setContext(Object context)
      Sets the context for this game.

    • Method Detail

      • getReport

        GameProgressListener getReport()
        Retrieve the main report of this game, detailing the progress of the game.
        Returns:
        The report. Null when game not played before.

      • play

        Map<Player,Integer> play(Playground playground,
                       Collection<Player> players,
                       File reportFolder)
        Initialize the game and play it through. Will throw an exception in case of a repeated call of this method on the same class instance. May throw IllegalStateException if setContext(Object) wasn't called first.
        Parameters:
        playground - The playground on which this game will be played out.
        players - A list of players to participate in the game.
        reportFolder - Where to output data, if necessary.
        Returns:
        Points gained by each player.

      • setContext

        void setContext(Object context)
        Sets the context for this game. The context should provide properties that the game should use to decide various situations.
        Parameters:
        context - This is a simple Object, since we don't want to enforce anything on the game implementations. Neither we know what to enforce.
